title: The Death of trees: Eucalyptus dieback
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Botany - Ecology
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Botany - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Trees - Australia

Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant diseases - Research - Australia
description: All over Australia trees are dying for reasons not fully understood. Scientists have termed this phenomenon "dieback". Within Australia a microscopic fungi and certain insects have been isolated as the cause of the massive destruction of jarrah, New England and eucalypt forests. Scientists are now looking at cloning techniques as a method of breeding trees that are genetically resistant to dieback.
